subject: Re: [junit] Testing OS specific end-of-lines in the standard out of a program
msgSnippet: If you always use a PrintWriter(), then you have no such problems. PrintWriter handles the differing line separators for you. Wrap a PrintWriter around... * a
messageBody:
If you always use a PrintWriter(), then you have no such problems.
PrintWriter handles the differing line separators for you.

Wrap a PrintWriter around...
* a StringWriter in your tests, so you can examine the string.
* an OutputStream in your production environment, so you can output to
the console, a file or a pipe.

Always talk through a PrintWriter.

JBR.
